title: Coroner: Penn Lake Park Drowning Accidental
title_page: Coroner: Penn Lake Park Drowning Accidental
maintext:
The death of a 37-year-old Wilkes-Barre man found floating on a lake in Penn Lake Park Borough Tuesday morning has been ruled accidental.
White Haven Police Chief Tom Szoke said the ruling on David Young’s death was made after police collected witness statements. Young’s cause of death was listed as drowning.
An autopsy scheduled for Wednesday morning was not held, according to the Luzerne County Coroner’s Office.
Young’s body was found 15 feet from the shoreline in the residential community near White Haven around 10 a.m. Tuesday by a construction crew building a home near the water’s edge.
Investigators were looking into reports of a boating accident that happened Sunday, Szoke said.
Also assisting at the scene Tuesday were White Haven Fire Department, Wright Township police, state police at Hazleton, Valley Regional Fire and Rescue, and an officer from the Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Natural Resources.
— Amanda Christman
